page.title: 07 The Torpoint Ferry cont.1
page.content: -The ferries were at the mercy of the winds and tides. In 1829 the first steam powered ferry was built but it was not successful because it did not run on chains.It only lasted for 6 months and the ferry had to go back to the horse and foot boat.In 1832, 2 ferries which were steam driven and run on chains were designed.These ferries lasted until 1871 and 1878 respectively. Until 1895 the chain ferry stopped running at 9 p.m but people wanted a later service . Mr. Reynolds of the Torpoint tug company used three of his tug to provide a crossing service until 12.30 a.m.But in 1900 the ferry owner raised the tugs landing charges so much thet Mr. Reynolds stopped running his tugs. People of Torpoint were so angry thet the ferry owners had to arrange their own steamer _
